item.title: 10 Sim Games That Accidentally Become Existential Nightmares
item.description:
Simulator games are incredibly popular and addictive. While you can live the life of your dreams, there is also the chance that things can go very wrong. When developers attempt to mimic the nuances of complex events and processes, players can make choices that break the game's reality. One minute, you are attempting to understand jet propulsion, the next, you are flinging small dedicated science minions into the ether to die in the vacuum of space.

Did the developers intend for these games to make the player question their own moral integrity and significance in the vast expanse of the universe? Probably not, but that does not make the existential dread they inspire any less terrifying.

BeamNG.drive

Liminal spaces and unforgiving physics

BeamNG.Drive
Released
August 3, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
BeamNG
Genre(s)
Racing, Simulation
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

The physics-defying polygon-warping, soft body-crushing chaos that is BeamNG.Drive is a delightful physics sandbox. Players have a huge amount of freedom to create intricate races and innovative contraptions. Alternatively, they can make a liminal hellscape from which there is no escape. Add user-generated BeamNG.drive mods into the mix, and you get a recipe for disaster.

The vanilla game is largely uninhabited, and there is an eerie stillness to the environments. Some that have been painstakingly created, others are eerily vacant with blank squares stretching out as far as the eye can see. If empty liminal spaces don't creep you out, then maybe the lifeless stares of the crash test dummies and their violent deaths at the hands of players will.

Totally Accurate Battle Simulator

The terrible march of existential horror

Totally Accurate Battle Simulator
Strategy
Systems
Released
April 1, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Landfall
Genre(s)
Strategy
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox One, PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Android, iOS, Nintendo Switch
Powered by

Where else can you send one lonely bard into battle against an army of snake throwers, and he will blindly walk towards certain doom with a blank look on his face? Totally Accurate Battle Simulator is a charmingly goofy game that simulates improbable battles in the most hilariously reductive way possible.

Players set up armies against each other, and these troops then slowly march towards each other and attack according to their type. Archers shoot bows (or snakes), hobbits ineffectively swarm enemy units, and Zeus units literally throw lightning bolts. Obviously, some units are better equipped for battle than others, and TABS has no problem letting you send a harmless lute-playing idiot to his death at the hands of the god of thunder.

Cities: Skylines

Are the citizens there just to suffer?

Cities: Skylines
9 /10
Released
March 10, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Colossal Order
Genre(s)
City Builder
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Seires X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Cities: Skylines is a nuanced and detailed city-building and management simulator that allows players to establish a thriving society. Some people endeavor to make profitable megacities, others strive for a utopian city, and a select few creators delight in making terrifying purgatories for their citizens bombarded by endless natural disasters (with the "Natural Disasters" DLC).

Deliberate sabotage and despotic rule aside, it is very easy to accidentally turn a city into a miserable hell for its inhabitants. Players can accidentally find themselves contending with illness of pandemic proportions, catastrophically high crime rates, or a city that has caught on fire. Itâ€™s all part of the Cities: Skylines experience.

Two Point Hospital

How much is a human life worth?

Two Point Hospital
Released
August 30, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Two Point Studios
Genre(s)
Simulation
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One
Powered by

Is Two Point Hospital a cute medical admin simulator, or a bleak, scathing indictment of the for-profit medical industry? It really depends on who is playing it. There are plenty of ways to cause existential dread accidentally or on purpose, from the grim mistreatment of employees to goofy diseases with terrifying implications. Should you cure their bizarre ailments or let patients suffer in the halls of your hospital?

When a patient dies in the ward, they calmly get up out of bed, go to the changing room, get dressed, and then collapse on the floor. If this death ritual wasnâ€™t bleak enough, patients who have died on the premises stick around as ghosts, haunting the hallways and leaving ectoplasm everywhere.

Planet Zoo

Maybe the player should be in the zoo

Planet Zoo
Released
November 5, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Frontier Developments
Genre(s)
Simulation
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

If any type of simulator game is going to make somebody question their own morality and what it means to be human or humane, itâ€™s a zoo simulator. Planet Zoo really makes the player question who should be in charge of this situation, along with wondering whether humans should be in the zoo. It is so easy to inadvertently make life a waking nightmare for endangered species.

Animal rights aren't the only concern in Planet Zoo. Employees are often mistreated, and guests can be trapped in a literal tourist trap. Even the most well-meaning player can end up with an absolute catastrophe that violates multiple human and animal rights agreements.

The Long Drive

Driving the player to road madness

The Long Drive
Simulation
Open-World
Survival
Systems
Released
September 25, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Genesz
Early Access Release
September 25, 2019
Genre(s)
Simulation, Open-World, Survival
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Aside from the overt horror elements of The Long Drive , the sheer maddening loneliness and isolation can stick with the player. The player embarks on a seemingly pointless one-way journey with only the monsters and a blow-up doll for company. Many start The Long Drive expecting a weird and unsettling survival simulator experience, only to end up in a full-blown existential nightmare.

The procedurally generated environments can be extremely cruel, with some players ending up with a relatively creepy but uneventful journey and others ending up in a disturbing dystopian wasteland. It is the luck of the draw, which can be said for life in general.

Gas Station Simulator

Nothing creates existential terror like isolation.

Gas Station Simulator
Simulation
Systems
Released
September 15, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
DRAGO entertainment
Genre(s)
Simulation
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
Powered by

When on an endless road trip through a procedurally generated purgatory, why not stop off at the most cursed gas station since Kentucky Route Zero ? While there are certainly elements of this offbeat simulation that are intentionally unsettling, the silent appearance and rapid, physics-defying exit of the NPCs will likely be enough to put most players on edge.

Customers make strange utterances, and there is bizarre environmental storytelling scattered throughout the landscape. It is one of those games where it is hard to tell where the deliberate uncanny design ends and the accidental horror begins.

Cooking Simulator

The loneliness of a hospitality purgatory.

Cooking Simulator
Simulation
Systems
Released
June 6, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Genre(s)
Simulation
Powered by

One person, locked in a kitchen, is forced to serve food to an increasingly demanding faceless customer base. Is there anyone even out there? Itâ€™s a terrible capitalist nightmare of an inescapable kitchen with no human contact. Itâ€™s no wonder that many enslaved chefs of Cooking Simulator choose to end their time in the kitchen with the aid of highly combustible gas canisters and an oven.

Subscribe for sharper takes on simulator oddities

Get the newsletter for deeper explorations of simulator games: thoughtful analysis, curated picks, and behind-the-scenes perspectives that unpack why these sims unsettle and fascinate, plus broader gaming coverage.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnetâ€™s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Subsequent installments and DLC have fleshed out the universe a little, but even then, unsettling details remain. For example, why is the Cooking Network show's audience made of cardboard? And, why can you enter Super Hot Mode? Itâ€™s all very concerning.

Kerbal Space Program

Sacrifice them for science!

Kerbal Space Program
Released
April 27, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Franchise
Kerbal Space Program
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Genre(s)
Simulation
Powered by

Kerbal Space Program asks players to advance scientific endeavors and attempt to refine space travel at any cost. For some reason, the best way to achieve this is to put an untrained person in charge of countless Kerbal lives. In a similar fashion to the blindly loyal units of Totally Accurate Battle Simulator , the player repeatedly sends adorable smiling astronauts to their almost certain doom.

These little guys are ready to die for your scientific ambitions. Like many sims, the power dynamic in Kerbal Space Program is incredibly troubling and can fill the player with deep moral conflict and existential dread if they think about it slightly too hard.

The Sims 2

Hell is other people.

The Sims 2
Released
September 14, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Maxis
Platform(s)
PC, macOS, Nintendo Game Boy Advance, GameCube, Nintendo DS, PS2, PSP, Xbox (Original)
Genre(s)
Life Simulation
Powered by

Not many games present the player with a physical incarnation of death to bargain with or dramatize the process of a family falling apart. Any of the entries in The Sims series can be existentially terrifying in the right hands, but The Sims 2 has some of the weirdest semi-random events in video game history.

From the bizarre and self-destructive loops that the Sims themselves get stuck in to the appearance of the cursed Social Bunny, who shows up when certain sims socials get too low, The Sims 2 often seems like a horrific fever dream. This tradition of surreal, existential horror would continue throughout subsequent installments and has become somewhat of a beloved eccentricity of the series.

item.title: Pokemon GO Is Adding Another New Gen 9 Pokemon for January 2026
item.description:
Pokemon GO 's newest January 2026 event is adding a brand-new Pokemon from the franchise's ninth generation, with Glimmet set to join the roster. The mobile game from Scopely has already seen plenty of new debuts throughout the first month of January, ranging from new Pokemon to Shiny variants. Pokemon GO 's Pinch Perfect event introduced Gen 9 Pokemon Klawf to the mobile game, while the upcoming Precious Pals event is set to feature the first appearance of Shiny Fidough. Pokemon 's most recent generation has been a particular focus for Scopely, as of late.

Pokemon GO has seen loads of debuts throughout recent months from new Pokemon first introduced in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet . Each month has typically seen at least one to two Pokemon from Pokemon Scarlet and Violet brought to the game, adding creatures like Nacli and Tarountula. Pokemon GO has also seen previous leaks suggesting that several upcoming Scarlet and Violet Pokemon may already be included in the game's files, including Ogerpon, Terapagos, and Pecharunt, among others. Now, Pokemon GO is gearing up to debut yet another new Pokemon from the franchise's ninth generation.

Pokemon GO Adding Glimmet in New Event

  • New Pokemon : Glimmet
  • Wild Encounters : Diglett, Dunsparce, Meditite, Yungoos
  • 7 km Eggs : Diglett, Larvitar, Bagon, Deino, Yungoos
  • Paid Time Research : $1.99 USD, 2 Incubators, Encounters with Diglett, Yungoos, and Glimmet, and more
  • 3x XP
  • 1/2 Egg Hatch Distance

Pokemon GO officially unveiled its upcoming Into the Depths event through the game's social media accounts. The event will add Glimmet to the game as its main featured Pokemon, though Into the Depths does not appear to include its shiny variant. The Pokemon GO event will feature boosted spawns for several different Pokemon, raising the rates for Diglett, Dunsparce, Meditite, and Yungoos, among others. 7 km Eggs will also give players the chance to hatch some particularly noteworthy Pokemon from throughout the game's history, boasting some pseudo-Legendaries like Larvitar, Bagon, and Deino. Pokemon GO 's Into the Depths event is scheduled to officially begin on January 27 at 10:00 AM local time, running through February 1 at 8:00 PM.

Pokemon GO 's newest event will offer a plethora of perks for players beyond its featured Pokemon. Players will be able to benefit from triple the experience gained from completing Pokemon GO 's Routes during the event, alongside the hatching distance for eggs being cut in half. Some of the spotlight Pokemon will also see their Shiny Rates boosted during the event, particularly for Diglett and Yungoos out of the revealed creatures. A Timed Research is set to be available throughout the duration of Into the Depths, gifting players with two Incubators and Encounters with Diglett, Yungoos, and Glimmet.

Pokemon GO Has Seen a Busy Start to 2026

Pokemon GO 's Into the Depths joins a busy January schedule for Pokemon GO , already running two versions of one of its most popular events. Pokemon GO ran two different Community Day events throughout January, with a Community Day Classic starring Piplup on January 4 and a Grookey Community Day on January 18. Pokemon GO has even revealed its next big Shadow Raid Day event on January 24, with players able to challenge Shadow Raikou for a limited time. Pokemon GO 's announcement of Into the Depths teased more details to come about the event closer to its launch, as well.

While January still has lots in store for Pokemon GO fans, some players are already looking ahead to the next month of the game. Leaks from Pokemon GO have already confirmed the featured Pokemon for February's Community Day event, with Vulpix and Alolan Vulpix set to receive their first event. Pokemon is also gearing up for its next big anniversary event to come, with the franchise set to officially celebrate its 40th anniversary with plenty likely on the way for the game. Pokemon GO fans should have lots to look forward to from the game throughout the next couple of months.

PokÃ©mon GO

item.title: Brawl Stars QR Codes (January 2026)
item.description:
As befits the MOBA genre, in Brawl Stars players need to communicate with each other to win. To do this, you can use different Pins. There are many ways to get them, but the best is to use Brawl Stars QR codes.

These codes can reward you with various free goodies, including Pins and even Icons. However, after a certain time after the release, they become inactive. So you should hurry to use them.

Updated January 18, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: There are several working QR codes for Brawl Stars that unlock free icons and pins. These rewards are cosmetic and allow you to customize your profile with different visuals. Scanning them while they are still active is the best way to make sure you receive the items. This guide is updated regularly, so checking back later may bring additional QR rewards.

All Brawl Stars QR Codes

Working Brawl Stars QR Codes

Scan this code to get a free Icon

Scan this code to get a free Icon

Scan this code to get a free Icon

Scan this code to get a free Pin

Scan this code to get a free Pin

Scan this code to get a free Pin

Scan this code to get a free Pin

Expired Brawl Stars QR Codes

There are no expired QR codes in Brawl Stars . We will update this article as soon as more codes become available.

Brawl Stars gives players a wide variety of different game modes. And while some of them require teamwork, others can be won solo. But in any case, you will want to customize your game profile. This can be done with the help of various Icons and Pins. The latter are used as emotes during matches. And to unlock them at the beginning of the game, you should scan Brawl Stars QR codes.

GR Report: Subscribe and never miss what matters

Level up your gaming knowledge with Game Rant, packed with news, reviews, and insights from the gaming world.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnetâ€™s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

The developers release these QR codes during updates, events, or just to please the players. The codes contain various rewards, which are mainly cosmetic. But as always, their activity period is limited, so we do not recommend you delay using them.

How to Redeem Brawl Stars QR codes

Using Brawl Stars QR codes is a little different from other mobile games. However, it is still quite easy. You just need to follow these simple steps:

  • First, launch Brawl Stars and go through a short tutorial.
  • After that, scan the QR code with your phone's camera and follow the link.
  • Then tap Claim Reward.
  • This will open Brawl Stars , after which you need to tap Claim again to get your well-deserved rewards.

How to Get More Brawl Stars QR Codes

As with other mobile games, developers release free goodies quite often. But they can easily be missed by players. So, if you want to learn about Brawl Stars QR Codes first-hand, you should visit the official developers's social media pages.

  • Brawl Stars X page
  • Brawl Stars Facebook page
  • Brawl Stars YouTube channel
Brawl Stars
Released
December 12, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Supercell
Publisher(s)
Supercell
Platform(s)
iOS, Android
Genre(s)
Shooter, Action RPG, MOBA
Powered by

item.title: Heartopia Players Are Building Life-Sized Dollhouses, Convenience Stores, and More
item.description:
Heartopia players are flexing their creative muscles with some impressive builds using the hit new indie game's deep house-building mechanics. The free-to-play Steam game combines elements of other cozy life-sim games like Animal Crossing , The Sims , and Stardew Valley to give players a virtual sandbox to relax, participate in various hobbies like fishing, cooking, and gardening, and create the house of their dreams.

Cozy games have really blown up on Steam in recent years, and Heartopia is the latest title to take the genre by storm. Its free-to-play nature gives Heartopia a very low barrier to entry, and cements it as a worthy competitor to something like Animal Crossing: New Horizons . With a robust set of tools for designing and building their house in Heartopia , some players have let their imagination run wild and crafted some beautiful, cute, and even crazy houses.

Heartopia Already Has Some Fantastic Builds to Inspire Other Players

Heartopia Life-Sized Dollhouse

Reddit user seinisteria shared their massive life-sized dollhouse on the Heartopia subreddit, showcasing its various rooms in a cross-section perspective, much like how a real dollhouse would be displayed. The dollhouse features three stories and a total of nine rooms. While Seinisteria reveals that they are still collecting Heartopia furniture, a piano, a bathtub, and a full kitchen are included in their build.

Heartopia Squidward House

Leaning into the more wacky Heartopia builds out there, Reddit user Appropriate_Joke_239 showcases their take on Squidward's house from SpongeBob , recreated in Heartopia. Squidward's house is based on an Easter Island Head or Moai statue, which is the inspiration behind this Heartopi a house as well. Use Appropriate_Joke_239 also notes that they want to recreate all of Bikini Bottom in Heartopia as well.

Heartopia Minecraft Fox House

Although it's less of a house and more of a sculpture, Reddit user Tangerine_Proper has created a replica of Minecraft 's fox mob in Heartopia . This cute build features the fox curled up asleep in a very accurate portrayal of its Minecraft counterpart. The build does still function as a house with an interior accessible by a door in the tail.

Heartopia Japanese-Inspired House

This incredibly elegant Heartopia build was shared by Reddit user AdEquivalent9103 and includes several features inspired by Japanese architecture. However, AdEquivalent9103 notes that they had to spend around 600-700 Heart Diamonds to obtain all the house's fixtures, and that they struggled to get the roofs to stack correctly. But the results speak for themselves, and many commenters were envious of AdEquivalent9103 work.

Heartopia New York Apartment

Another impressively detailed Heartopia house build comes from Reddit user ellychu, who built an entire apartment building inspired by New York City. This build includes two full apartment structures connected by a fire escape staircase, and reportedly took ellychu around 3 hours to finish.

Heartopia 7-11 Convenience Store

Reddit user vvonivel also made a non-house build in Heartopia , crafting a surprisingly on-point representation of a 7-11 convenience store in the game. The store not only features accurate 7-11 branding on the outside, but a fully-stocked store on the inside for Heartopia players to roleplay a convenience store simulation within the game.

Heartopia Minecraft Weaponsmith House

Minecraft -themed houses seem to be a popular build option for Heartopia players, with Reddit user Sea-Significance5909 creating a replica of a Weaponsmith's house from Minecraft . The Weaponsmith's house can be found in Minecraft Villages and features a furnace and lava pool on the exterior, which Sea-Significance5909 has included in their build. On the inside, this Heartopia build is much more homey than its Minecraft inspiration, being fully furnished compared to the bare essentials and a single chest usually found in the Minecraft version.

5 Questions
Test Your Heartopia Build IQ: Can You Spot the Creative Gems?

item.title: The Underrated 84 Metacritic Co-OP ARPG With the Best Combat in the Genre (And It Makes Diablo 4 Feel Clunky)
item.description:
Despite having a rough launch in 2023 and still having several unresolved issues over two and a half years later, Diablo 4 is still one of the best ARPGs on the market by all standards. Path of Exile 2 is up there with fantastic class customization and builds, though the Soulslike gameplay hasn't hooked all fans. Between Last Epoch , the underrated Grim Dawn , PoE 1 and 2 , the still-in-the-works Titan Quest 2 , and more games, the competition for Diablo 4 is quite rich.

It's not every day that a new game comes out to challenge the status quo of hack-and-slash titles or action RPGs as a whole, but inadvertently, that's what happened when Shape of Dreams was released. Shape of Dreams was fully released just a couple of months ago, and while it's marketed as an action Roguelite rather than a full-blown ARPG like Diablo 4 , it does pack a lot of those sweet RPG features that elevate its action loop. Though the game has a more-than-respectable 84 score on MetaCritic and over 92% positive reviews on Steam, it has flown under the radar of many gamers, and you shouldn't be among them.

Why You Shouldn't Sleep on Shape of Dreams if You Like Diablo 4

At a glance, Shape of Dreams and Diablo 4 seem quite different. However, they aren't all that much, as proven by their respective features:

  • Shape of Dreams is an action Roguelite with a MOBA-like skill bar and ability system, and the typical isometric combat of ARPGs. Apart from the Roguelite elements, Diablo 4 shares these features for the most part.
  • Shape of Dreams features co-op for up to 4 players, and the same goes for multiplayer in Diablo 4 .
  • Highly customizable skills and builds are the bread and butter of both Shape of Dreams and Diablo 4 , including the option to swap things around while playing.
  • Shape of Dreams features 8 unique characters, whereas Diablo 4 has seven classes to choose from.
    • Diablo 4 's new Lord of Hatred class will be the eighth overall and will release in April 2026.

It's worth noting that many players praise Shape of Dreams' co-op because you can quit and rejoin from a different platform, or be disconnected and reconnect with no lost progress.

Differences Between Shape of Dreams and Diablo 4 Explained

I'm not saying Shape of Dreams is Diablo 4 or that it's straight-up better, as they do still have some key differences. For example, Shape of Dreams is best for quick sessions of play where you finish a run or two, and its progression is more based on moment-to-moment choices and modifiers that make each run different. Instead, Diablo 4 's loot progression makes your build something that gets better the more time you sink into playing, rather than quick power-ups in short sessions.

Which Character to Choose in Shape of Dreams

Much like Diablo 4 's classes determine what your experience playing the game will look like, so do Travelers in Shape of Dreams . This is due to characters having their own starting skills, called Memories, which have distinct effects and can be customized at will, while also giving you passive effects unique to your Traveler. However, upon completing the game's tutorial, only two Travelers are immediately available, and they are Lacerta and Mist.

  • Lacerta : A marksman using a rifle, fire, and explosives to dispose of his enemies.
  • Mist : Quick, agile sword combat with a focus on dealing massive damage while protecting herself.

The remaining six Shape of Dreams characters can only be unlocked by meeting certain conditions, such as gathering enough Dream Dust as a currency or defeating a given boss multiple times. These are:

  • Aurena : A melee support character focused on healing herself and allies while dealing damage.
  • Bismuth : Speed and ranged magic for quick runs and good damage at the cost of survivability.
  • Nachia : A ranged support with a penchant for summoning spirits to heal and deal damage.
  • Shell : A wooden samurai assassin capable of moving swiftly while landing deadly melee blows.
  • Vesper : Paladin-like character with a huge hammer to defeat enemies and the most armor in the game.
  • Yubar : A spellcaster with abilities about teleportation and AoE damage.

Diablo 4 May Be an Undisputed ARPG King, But Shape of Dreams' Combat is a Must-Try

The combat is where Shape of Dreams shines, though, as I think it feels snappier than Diablo 4 's by a huge margin. This is still fundamentally different, though, as Shape of Dreams is more based on the equivalent of MOBA skill shots rather than casting skills on yourself or nearby targets, so there's some getting used to it before it feels good. However, when you master it, the responsiveness of skills and how you position your character are very rewarding, and it feels like getting decent gear in Diablo 4 every single time, which to me is a big plus.

Customization is the Name of the Game in Shape of Dreams

Another important thing is that your Shape of Dreams character determines your starting skills, but you can get new ones each run and get to a point where none of your skills are from your starting kit. Furthermore, each skill can be customized with Essences, which, if you're familiar, act pretty much like Path of Exile 2 's Support Gems. You slot them into a given Memory and boost its performance or effects, which can completely change the gameplay. Both Essences and Memories can be purchased from vendors found throughout the map of a given run, but they can also drop at the end of each map section you complete.

Shape of Dreams' combat features dodge-rolling and avoiding telegraphed attacks to preserve your health.

This gives the combat incredible flexibility, and with this kind of fast-paced, quick-progression approach, Shape of Dream s feels more like leveling in Diablo 4 than its actual endgame, while also getting that kind of power level much faster. Being a Roguelite, Shape of Dreams does give you resources to customize your build and maximize your run, but it also means that when you die, it's over. Its snappy runs make up for it, though, so I never found it punitive. Rather, I can tell that when I die, it's my fault for taking on modifiers like Intense Curses, going to map nodes that are too dangerous, or fighting bosses too early.

Why You Should or Shouldn't Play Shape of Dreams

The scope is different, and I realize that the allure of Shape of Dreams is not the same as that of Diablo 4 , especially as someone who has historically preferred games with long-term replayability, like MMOs. Yet, I think the combat is what stands out here, and the game does deliver on its promise that there is no meta build and that each run is unique, which makes toying with Travelers, Memories, and Essences a hidden gem in the genre.

9 /10

Diablo 4
